fr.reflexe.viewshell.api.data.views

Interface IRange


  • public interface IRange
    Defines range parameters for a data source provided by a connector. Intended for implementing paging navigation and optimized data fetching.

    Thread safety: implementations are required to be immutable and therefore completely thread-safe.

    Since:
    1.0
    Author:
    REFLEXE Technologies
    See Also:
    IListStructure.createRange(long, long)

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void exportRange(OutputStream stream)
      Exports the range definition.
      <T> T exportRangeAs(Class<T> asType)
      Exports the range definition as an instance of the specified type, if such a conversion is supported.
      IConnector getConnector()
      Gets the connector that provides access to the data source.
      long getFirstIndex()
      Gets the inclusive first index for the list of items to fetch.
      long getLastIndex()
      Gets the inclusive last index for the list of items to fetch.
      default long getRangeCount()
      Gets the number of records in the range.
      ISource getSource()
      Gets the data source that provides access to records.

    • Method Detail

      • getSource

        ISource getSource()
        Gets the data source that provides access to records.
        Returns:
        the source.
        Since:
        1.0

      • getConnector

        IConnector getConnector()
        Gets the connector that provides access to the data source. This is the same as calling ISource.getSourceConnector() on the source.
        Returns:
        the connector.
        Since:
        1.0

      • getFirstIndex

        long getFirstIndex()
        Gets the inclusive first index for the list of items to fetch. The server will use this information in association with the sorting rules when fetching data.
        Returns:
        the inclusive first index, not less than zero.
        Since:
        1.0

      • getLastIndex

        long getLastIndex()
        Gets the inclusive last index for the list of items to fetch. The server will use this information in association with the sorting rules when fetching data.

        It is an error to define a range with the lastIndex set to a lower value than the firstIndex.

        It is not an error to specify out-of-bounds index values: in such cases, the server will fetch an empty list.

        Returns:
        the inclusive last index, not less than the first index.
        Since:
        1.0

      • getRangeCount

        default long getRangeCount()
        Gets the number of records in the range.
        Returns:
        lastIndex - firstIndex + 1.
        Since:
        1.0

      • exportRange

        void exportRange(OutputStream stream)
          throws IOException
        Exports the range definition.
        Parameters:
        stream - non-null stream to write to. The stream will not be closed by this method.
        Throws:
        IOException - if the definition cannot be exported to the supplied stream.
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        IRangeBuilder.importRange(java.io.InputStream)

      • exportRangeAs

        <T> T exportRangeAs(Class<T> asType)
        Exports the range definition as an instance of the specified type, if such a conversion is supported.
        Type Parameters:
        T - type of the class parameter and of the returned instance.
        Parameters:
        asType - the specified export type. There is no requirement for implementations to support any conversions other than to instances of String.
        Returns:
        an instance of the specified type, never null.
        Throws:
        UnsupportedOperationException - if the requested conversion is not supported by this implementation.
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        IRangeBuilder.importRange(Object)
